I think it's fair to say there are some days that we all question whether we are really making a difference with our children. Some days, the kids just don't seem to get it ...they are fighting, being mean, disrespectful and unkind to both peers and adults. Do they even hear what we are telling them? Do they even see the good behaviors we are modeling for them?

The video below came as a big surprise in my email yesterday morning....a good one, with perfect timing. It brightens my day to know that the values and attitudes we, as educators, and you, as family members, work so hard to foster in our children at a young age shine so brightly in their character as young adults! Way to go, Berlin community!

Brrrr...We live in the cold North Country! Just the same, we DO keep students in for morning and lunch recess if the temperature is zero or below with the wind chill according to the NOAA weather online but here's a few reminders for those days just above zero (hopefully coming soon!):

*Do NOT drop your child off before 7:40 am please! That's when our supervision starts and students are allowed inside when temps aren't above zero or it's raining.
*Dress in layers
*Mittens are warmer than gloves
*Send students with shoes to change into so feet don't become sweaty and wet in the warm building before going outside
*Don't forget the hat...a lot of heat is lost through the head.
*If your child is in need of some warm outerwear, let us know... we can help with that;)
